meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of mineralogy
meanings.sent1: The mineralogically rich soil was perfect for growing crystals.
meanings.sent2: The scientist made a mineralogically accurate model of the crystal structure.
meanings.sent3: She had a mineralogically precise collection of gemstones.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of minerals was so mineralogically deep, it seemed like he could see through rocks.
meanings.sent5: The mineralogically themed party was a hit among geology enthusiasts.

meanings.definition: in a manner pertaining to the study of minerals
meanings.sent1: She examined the rock mineralogically to identify its components.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the rock mineralogically under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The miner comically tried to eat the rock mineralogically, thinking it was candy.
meanings.sent4: The explorer navigated the cave mineralogically, searching for valuable minerals.
meanings.sent5: The student learned to think mineralogically, analyzing rocks with precision.
